# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here is a Julia function that will clean the column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```
This function first converts the string to lower case, then strips any leading or trailing whitespaces. It replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores using the `replace` function. The regular expression `r"[\s-]"` matches either a space or a hyphen.
